Credits

News

A1

Noomi Egan. A home built scanner helps to construct a beamline at ESS. Lund University Magazine – LUM. URL: https://www.staff.lu.se/article/home-built-scanner-helps-construct-beamline-ess (visited on 2022-12-15).

A2

LINXS - Lund Institute of Advance X-ray and Neutron Science. Video footage of Emanuel Larsson's kitchen-based light tomography (KBLT) scanner. YouTube. URL: https://youtu.be/IG4SvcRGRfY (visited on 2022-12-15).

A3

RISE Research Institutes of Sweden. Everything can be examined with tomography. YouTube. URL: https://youtu.be/55dcV0ItRck (visited on 2022-12-15).

A4

Gianluca Iori on Twitter. Our visible light tomography setup goes finally on stage tomorrow. URL: https://twitter.com/gianlucaiori/status/1462766397466021888?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw (visited on 2022-12-15).

A5

Jens Wenzel on Twitter. Emanuel Larsson instructs in the use of his kitchen-based light tomography scanner. URL: https://twitter.com/jens_wenzel/status/1431332115904348167 (visited on 2022-12-15).

A6

LINXS - Institute of Advanced Neutron and X-ray Science. French master students spend summer in a unique internship using x-ray microtomography. URL: https://www.linxs.se/news/2022/9/5/french-master-students-spend-summer-in-a-unique-internship-using-x-ray-microtomography (visited on 2022-12-15).

A7

LINXS - Institute of Advanced Neutron and X-ray Science. From kitchen tomography to a cutting edge neutron imaging beamline. URL: https://www.linxs.se/news/2021/10/11/from-kitchen-tomography-to-a-cutting-edge-neutron-imaging-beamlinenbsp (visited on 2022-12-15).

Useful links

B1

Emanuel Larsson. KBLT - kitchen-based light tomography. URL: https://github.com/mrbreaker86/KBLT (visited on 2022-12-15).

B2

Emanuel Larsson, Doga Gürsoy, and Stephen A. Hall. Kitchen-Based Light Tomography – a DIY toolkit for advancing tomography - by and for the tomography community. Tomography of Materials and Structures, 2022. URL: https://authors.elsevier.com/sd/article/S2949-673X(22)00001-8 (visited on 2022-12-15).

B3

E. Larsson, D. Gursoy, S. A. Hall. KBLT - kitchen-based light tomography data sets in the tomobank. URL: https://tomobank.readthedocs.io/en/latest/source/data/docs.data.kblt.html (visited on 2022-12-15).

B4

ROTOTRON 2004. Raspberry pi stepper motor tutorial. URL: https://www.rototron.info/raspberry-pi-stepper-motor-tutorial/ (visited on 2022-12-15).

Related educational projects

C1

Jerry Battista, Linada Kaci, Kurtis Dekker, Tiange Zhuang, and Kevin Jordan. Experiential Learning of Computed Tomography (CT) with an Optical CT Scanner 2. ResearchGate, 2020. URL: https://www.researchgate.net/publication/340105217_Experiential_Learning_of_Computed_Tomography_CT_with_an_Optical_CT_Scanner/ (visited on 2017-02-19).

C2

PHYWE - excellence in science. PHYWE - principles of ct scan. URL: https://www.phywe.eu/principles-of-ct-scan_11857/ (visited on 2022-03-23).

C3

Chutima Fong-on, Sarinporn Visitsattapongse, and C Pintavirooj. Embedded photographic tomography. In 2018 International Workshop on Advanced Image Technology (IWAIT), 1–3. IEEE, 2018. doi:10.1109/IWAIT.2018.8369710.

C4

Aniwat Juhong and Chuchart Pintavirooj. Simulated ct scanner for educational purpose. In 2016 9th Biomedical Engineering International Conference (BMEiCON), 1–4. IEEE, 2016. doi:10.1109/BMEiCON.2016.7859589.

C5

Sébastien Tosi Julien Colombelli. LEMOLish - light sheet microscopy at your fingertips. URL: https://lemolish.mystrikingly.com/ (visited on 2022-10-26).

C6

Axel Kittenberger, Leonidas Mindrinos, and Otmar Scherzer. Computed origami tomography. SIAM Review, 64(2):469–484, 2022. doi:10.1137/20M1378247.

C7

Charles Modrich. Openopti (a cheap open-source 3d microscope). URL: https://www.thingiverse.com/thing:2121016/ (visited on 2017-02-19).

C8

Karim Panjvani, Anh V Dinh, and Khan A Wahid. LiDARPheno–A low-cost lidar-based 3D scanning system for leaf morphological trait extraction. Frontiers in plant science, 10:147, 2019. doi:10.3389/fpls.2019.00147.

C9

Burkhard Schillinger. An Affordable Image Detector and a Low-Cost Evaluation System for Computed Tomography Using Neutrons, X-rays, or Visible Light. Quantum Beam Science, 3(4):21, 2019. doi:10.3390/qubs3040021.

C10

Gary S Settles. Schlieren and shadowgraph techniques: visualizing phenomena in transparent media. Springer Science & Business Media, 2001. ISBN 978-3-642-56640-0. URL: https://link.springer.com/book/10.1007/978-3-642-56640-0 (visited on 2022-12-15).

C11

Gary S Settles and Michael J Hargather. A review of recent developments in schlieren and shadowgraph techniques. Measurement Science and Technology, 28(4):042001, 2017. doi:10.1088/1361-6501/aa5748.

C12

Siddharth Vaghela. 3D Scanning with Raspberry Pi and MATLAB. URL: https://www.hackster.io/strangeloop/3d-scanning-with-raspberry-pi-and-matlab-cc30e8/ (visited on 2016-06-24).

C13

Bart E Vos, Emil Betz Blesa, and Timo Betz. Designing a high-resolution, LEGO-based microscope for an educational setting. The Biophysicist, 2(3):29–40, 2021. doi:10.35459/tbp.2021.000191.
